comment: Did not have this one – had their Rye. Did not like it – tasted like tequila.

Tastes like salt water.
I was at a whisky tasting and talked to the vendor representing them and he agreed some of the early vintages were horrid.

Honestly I don't think it's worth a redemptive try.
Had it at the village.  Smooth,light,easy drinking,carmel
Light with a touch of sweet.

I’m impressed with the flavor profile they were able to obtain in such a short amount of time. It’s a good entry into the world of single malt.  It’s smooth and sweet with a nice finish that slowly fades away.
Alls I know is, not pleasant...the end!
Thin. Jameson like. Alcohol on the finish.

Was definitely disappointed because I love the Dead Guy Whiskey. 
Nose: Very Sour 
Pallet: The saving grace. Surprisingly sweet,  caramelly and smooth.
Finish: Very bitter

I'm guessing this is the same as Chatoe Rogue from Oregon but I can't find a listing for it. Anyway, I'll rate it here. Sourmash nose. Sweet, very sweet even for a rye. Tastes a little underrefined. Still, it does its job.
